队友虐我千百遍，我待队友如初恋，玩了几百小时了，无论是刚入坑时候听到心跳害怕到不敢动，还是现在的主动到屠夫面前去调皮，玩这个游戏的激情一直没有变，主要是因为这游戏能让人感觉到人类之间的默契合作以及人性的温暖，每一次的对局中，无论队友如何不堪，我都会去尽我最大努力去帮助他们，援救他们，这不是乐于助人，而是在保护伙伴，在坚持信念，所以在我离开这片黑雾之前，我无论如何都不会让屠夫伤害到我的伙伴！

[h1]This game has so much potential, but the developers and the extremely toxic side of the community keeps it from being the game it could be.[/h1]

Dead by Daylight. A cross-platform, isometric 4 vs 1 survival horror game. Where 4 survivors work together to repair generators, power the exit gates and escape from the brutal killer trying to stop you from escaping by any means. You can play many different unique survivors and killers, some original to the series and some are horror icons from series such as: Halloween, Texas Chainsaw Massacre, A Nightmare on Elm Street, Saw, Scream, Silent Hill, Resident Evil, Hellraiser, Ringu and more. Each character has their own set of abilities/perks you can earn that reflect their backstories and later on can be obtained on your other characters too. As well as items you can bring to help get an edge on your opponent. There's also a decent amount of maps, some being inspired by the aforementioned iconic horror series. A ranking system that I'll talk more about below... The game also has a "battle pass" called "The Rift" where you complete challenges, both as survivor and killer to earn cosmetics, every game has one nowadays - up to you how you feel about that. 

Overall, the game sounds awesome - right? Unique, thrilling, and intense. Don't get me wrong, it can be at times, but its rare anymore. So here's my 3 major reasons why:

- The developers are constantly introducing game-breaking bugs into the game. Every major update, without fail. To the point that they often have to disable entire characters, perks and maps. Even on launch day after over a month of public beta testing. And it often takes months to fix, if they even fix it all. There are glitches that have been around in this game for well over a year that go unaddressed or an attempt is made to fix it, only to make it worse. However in the meantime, they're happily releasing paid cosmetics every other week it seems like.

- The community has made up an arbitrary set of rules that you must follow or else you're a horrible, toxic player. Things that are freely made available in the game for you to use, are now off limits because a group of the player base says they're not fair. This problem is exacerbated through social media as entitled players publicly shame other players for choosing to play a certain way and making new, impressionable players feel like they need to follow these completely made-up rules. Along with other players who are just straight up there to make everyone else miserable by being as mean as they possibly can - which you get in every game so it is what it is.

- The ranking system. Its a complete joke. Ash, Bronze, Silver, Gold and Iridescent. If you've played other games with a ranking system, you'd think Iridescent would mean you're a highly skilled player and have spent a lot of time learning how to play, but all it takes to achieve this rank is time. Play enough matches before the rank reset (every month on the 13th) and you can achieve Iridescent I while being an average player, maybe even a below average player. There's a lot of skills you can learn, both as killer and survivor that would make you a skilled player, but they're all mostly unnecessary to achieve the highest rank in this game. Also, you can be Ash, brand new to the game and end up in a match against Iridescent players. There's little to no meaning to the ranks and all you get is some free bloodpoints (the game's main currency) every month.

- a whole lot more.

Now, obviously at nearly 1,000 hours - I must enjoy this game, right? I do, but these problems really wear down my desire to play. Some nights are entirely unenjoyable and I'm simply just playing because I bought the "Rift Pass" and don't want my money to go to waste. So, do I recommend this game? No. Not in its current state. Especially not if you're someone who gets addicted to a game and can't step away, even when its frustrating you. Its hard to step away when there's no other game like it. If I was getting bored of Skyrim, I could play Fallout. When you need a break from Dead by Daylight - there's really not much of an option that will give you the same feeling. So you get stuck playing this game, even when ultimately its making you miserable lol.

Узнал про данный проект, только в 2020-ом году, очень зацепило, начинал с консоли, совсем недавно перешёл на ПК... Жаль, что нельзя перенести прогресс, но поправимо) Время жалко всё же) У игры свои плюсы и минусы, мне проще, так как не знал её раннюю версию... Баланса и подбор - полный рандом... Есть 2-3 маньяка, позволяющие делать -4 на красных рангах, против дискордных пати... Остальные либо по фану, либо по ситуации) Тиммейты за сурва, тоже рандом, не зависимо от ранга) Но мне нравится)

Okay, so I really enjoy this game. There's plenty to learn about tons of perks for both survivors and killers. So the learning curve can be harsh at the start. They seem to add killers fairly frequently or make changes to perks in some way that in the time I've owned it, the game hasn't stagnate. Also the change between third person for survivors and first person for killers is interesting. 

There are of course trolls, but most any game you play with people will have that. 

If you're looking for a game to get into that you play as a team (survivor) or looking to just get into a competitive solo experience (killer) check it out.

Imagine tomorrow they announce that iridescent head has been changed from one tap hatchets but you don't have as many to you only have 1 hatchet but after you throw it hits someone and comes back to you like mjolnir and as its flying back it can hit people. They just need to do more changes like the one they did for lucky break.

Deje este juego durante un año y lo que mas me arrepiento fue haber pensado en volver. Su comunidad es como la mierda. La jugabilidad como killer es del asco y no puedes jugar ni de killer ni de survivor sin tener las perks meta rotas del juego. Lo que significa tener que gastar dinero y tiempo de farmeo jugando, y cuando llegas al punto de tenerlas, te toca hacer mas farmeo para conseguir todas las perks farmeadas en un solo personaje, para que te toque o compañeros asquerosamente malos o Survivor asquerosamente tryhard y toxicos. El matchmaking no fue arreglado en su momento y sigue sin hacerlo porque a los creadores les importa llenarse los bolsillos
